intro: Crantzia lindenii, commonly known as the Lindens' crantzia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually small, clustered, and come in shades of yellow, orange, or red. Crantzia lindenii is often found in coastal and inland regions where it thrives in full sun.
